results.title: Wire sculpture
results.brief_description: An exploration into the design and construction of “kinetic” sculpture with steel wire and acetylene torch. Joe Police, a freelance artist, constructs a movable sculpture of a human head. He relates his experiences in learning his craft and comments on his philosophy of art and creativity. The film is complimented by Peter Coraggio’s “Electronic Sound Sculpture”.

results.title: Wir Stellen Uns Vor
results.brief_description: Designed for students of elementary German. Consists of three self contained documentary film sequences showing young Germans using simple language in authentic exchanges from their everyday lives.

results.title: Wipe Out the Jargon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions, Eve Ash and Ted Robinson
results.brief_description: The characters in this madcap program (a pen, a pencil and liquid paper) spearhead an attack on jargon and woolly-writing. They demonstrate how to improve letter and report writing skills by isolating the four principles of clear, well structured letters and reports: Be clear, Order, Evaluate. Short notes accompany the program.

results.title: Winterfun Canada
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films, Jim Turpie and Pat Crawley
results.brief_description: This film is a lively mosaic of how Canadians use winter as a source of recreation and entertainment. We go from coast to coast catching a view of virtually every winter sport and outdoor pastime - from the grace of figure skating to the mayhem of a car race on a frozen lake. Aside from all the action, the camera often stops along the way and lingers on the frozen stillness of the long Canadian Winter. No narration.

results.title: Winter sleepers = Winterschlafer
results.creator_credit: X filme creative Pool, Filmstiftung NRW, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Palladio Film, WDR, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, German Independents, Stefan Arndt and Tom Tykwer
results.brief_description: Tykwer’s elaborately designed second feature, which preceded his commercially successful ‘Run Lola Run’ (1998), is set in a ski village in a remote province in southern Germany. The plot follows the various threads that connect the confused lives of two couples in their thirties. Theo, a projectionist in the local theatre, steals a car belonging to lovers Rebecca and Marco and takes it for a joyride. He collides with the car of a local farmer gravely injuring his daughter, but due to a short term memory loss, leaves the scene without helping the injured girl or her family. Later he becomes involved with Laura, a nurse, who has been taking care of the girl. Both couples are rootless and without ambition or drive, and Tywker uses the time allowed by his elliptical narrative to compare and contrast the two relationships on display. He deploys stylistic formalism to make connections between what are essentially shallow characters. Their incompatibilities are underpinned by the use of colour-coding, while the repeated use of lap dissolves sets up unexpected connections between them. Cast includes Floriane Daniel, Heino Ferch, Ulrich Matthes, Marie-Lou Sellem and Josef Bierbichler. In German with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: X filme creative Pool, Filmstiftung NRW, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Palladio Film, WDR, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, German Independents, Stefan Arndt and Tom Tykwer

results.title: Winter of the witch
results.creator_credit: Parents' Magazine Films, Learning Corporation of America, Thomas Sand and Gerald Herman
results.brief_description: Nicky and his mother buy an old house where a three hundred-year-old witch lives. Each day Nick brings her the paper and she realizes that everyone is so sad that there is no need to scare them anymore. She becomes the family cook and amazes everyone with her “happiness” pancakes, until her motive is revealed. Based on “Old Black Witch” by Wende and Harry Devlin. Narrated by Burgess Meredith. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Parents’ Magazine Films, Learning Corporation of America, Thomas Sand and Gerald Herman

results.title: Winter of our dreams
results.creator_credit: Vega Film Productions, Richard Mason and John Duigan
results.brief_description: An unstable relationship develops between prostitute Louise (Judy Davis), and a married man Rob (Bryan Brown), following the suicide of a mutual friend, Lisa. Lou (Davis), who is left with Lisa’s diaries becomes infatuated by her friend’s life and unrequited passion for Rob. She attempts to assume Lisa’s identity, in appearance, thoughts and actions, which poses the viewer with the question, will she too end her life? Lou sees in Rob an avenue for salvation from her life of drug addiction and prostitution. It is a destructive relationship, with Rob giving her little encouragement or hope. Rob is drawn to Lou for the possible insight she can offer into the years that passed between his sudden departure from Lisa and his now, unconventional marriage. Ultimately, it is a one sided relationship and Lou must decide whether she can make something of her life. Cast includes Bryan Brown, Judy Davis, Cathy Downes and Baz Luhrmann.
